intro: Galium bielzii, commonly known as the Mexican bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, and it produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Galium bielzii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
